text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5e9460606ad694000488d4b4|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-25" to "claire-and-aran"
name: claire-and-aran

text:
Hey Aran, please meet Claire your incredible E-Mentor we've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or penny-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi Aran, hope you’re having a great bank holiday weekend! Let me know what queries you have? Thanks Claire

Hey Claire, first of all thank you for taking helping me, out of your own time!

I’m 17 and about a year ago last September I started my own freelance animation and graphic design business.

After about 2 months I started getting more clients and rev

I was in school and doing quite well in fact! 

But after dealing with real life clients and seeing how the world works, I realized that school wasn’t that beneficial to what I wanted in my future - so I decided to search for video editing and VFX Apprentiships! as that way I could secure a qualification, more experience and get paid on top!
After a short while I landed a level 4 Apprentiship at a small VFX studio and they loved my work and offered my a short 4 week traineeship then Apprentiship!

Unfortunately due to financial issues they had to fire some of their staff and where unable to continue my apprenticeship.



I did complete my traineeship at the studio which is good - but I’m now currently searching for a new apprenticeship! And that is what I would like your help and advice for.


Thanks again for giving my this opportunity and for listening

Hi Aran, wow you have done a lot for 17 already and its great that you are trying routes out to see what you like, which is important! Its also good; you’ve got some client experience and are building your freelance/passion projects in your spare time, which is fab!

A lot of people I work with have taken different routes into the industry; including me, they might retrain more than once during their careers and/or hold multiple roles etc. Apprenticeships are becoming more available in the media industry, which is great to see, as they previously were quite office or construction based. 

How can I help with your apprenticeship search? Are you looking for schemes or studios to approach and how to approach them? What roles in VFX are you looking for experience in? Please let me know how I can best advise you and happy to help!!
